dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form

Class ValueConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.gui.form.ValueConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTableRowValueConverter, AbstractTreeTableRowValueConverter, BooleanValueConverter, FloatValueConverter, IntegerValueConverter

    public class ValueConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.lang.String>
    A ValueConverter is used to convert between text, numbers etc. entered by the user or shown to the user and the format in which the text is internally stored.

    To get information about the row of an SWTTable or SWTTreeTable implement AbstractTableRowValueConverter or {AbstractTreeTableRowValueConverter.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2009.a

    • Method Detail

      • doInit

        public void doInit(ISWTWidget widget)
        Connect the ValueConverter to its SWTTable or SWTTreeTable.

        This method is called after the controller has been connected to the widget.

        Parameters:
        widget - the widget to associate with
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doSupportsSeparator

        public boolean doSupportsSeparator()
        Query if this ValueConverter is capable of showing separators when converting to view.

        The default implementation returns false.

        Returns:
        true if separators can be shown
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getShowSeparator

        public boolean getShowSeparator()
        Query if separators should be shown.
        Returns:
        true if separators should be shown
        Since:
        2009.a

      • setSeparator

        public void setSeparator(boolean separator)
        Called by the GUI to enable showing separators.
        Parameters:
        separator - true to show separators
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doSupportsNumberFormat

        public boolean doSupportsNumberFormat()
        Query if a number format (hex, oct, dec, bin) can be selected by the user.
        Returns:
        true if the ValueConverter supports number formats
        Since:
        2009.a

      • getNumberFormat

        public ValueConverter.NumberFormat getNumberFormat()
        Query the number format in which numbers should be shown in the GUI.

        If doSupportsNumberFormat() is false this value should be ignored else it should be considered in doConvertToView(String).

        Returns:
        the numberFormat in which numbers are shown in the table
        Since:
        2009.a

      • setNumberFormat

        public void setNumberFormat(ValueConverter.NumberFormat numberFormat)
        Called by the GUI to set the number format in which numbers should be shown.
        Parameters:
        numberFormat - the numberFormat to set
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doVerifyValue

        public boolean doVerifyValue(java.lang.String original,
                             java.lang.String value)
        Verifies the value during user input.

        By default the method returns true allowing to pass all data.

        Parameters:
        original - the last value
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        true if it is legal for the user to enter the value
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doConvertToView

        public java.lang.String doConvertToView(java.lang.String value)
        Converts the value from the model into the form in which it shall be displayed.

        The default is to return the value as it is

        Parameters:
        value - The value to convert
        Returns:
        The displayed value
        Since:
        2009.a

      • doConvertToData

        public java.lang.String doConvertToData(java.lang.String value)
        Converts a value entered by the user to the form that should be saved to the model.

        The default is to return the value as it is

        Parameters:
        value - The value to convert.
        Returns:
        The converted value
        Since:
        2.0
